input_text:
Job Title: Project Automation Engineer II

Location: Houston, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Join the industry leader to design the next generation of breakthroughs

WHY HONEYWELL?

Honeywell changes the way the world works.

Honeywell’s history of changing the world through innovation and life-changing technology has always started with our people. We succeed when you thrive, supported by a culture of continuous learning, challenging work, and celebrated achievements. Discover your full potential.

Are you ready to help us make the future?

Be part of a team assessing and driving achievement of program specific performance within Honeywell Process Solutions. You will partner with world class engineers and leaders to implement industrial distributed control system projects by applying product knowledge while creating configurations, documents, and custom programming elements.

Responsibilities

 Design and develop automation control systems based on client requirements.  Provide technical support and troubleshooting for automation control systems and guidance to project teams and clients  Conduct system testing and validation to ensure functionality and performance.  Stay updated with industry trends and advancements in automation control systems.  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to analyze control system requirements and design strategies to ensure successful project execution.  Perform troubleshooting and debugging of control systems  Ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations  Document control system design, specifications, and test plans 

U.s. Person Requirements

Due to compliance with U.S. export control laws and regulations, candidate must be a U.S. Person, which is defined as, a U.S. citizen, a U.S. permanent resident, or have protected status in the U.S. under asylum or refugee status or have the ability to obtain an export authorization.

MUST HAVE

Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution in a technical discipline such as Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or related field.3+years of experience in designing and implementing automation control systems.Strong knowledge of PLC programming, HMI development, or SCADA systems.Proficiency in industry-standard automation control software and toolDevelop and implement control system software, including programming and configurationTravel required for the positionConduct system integration and testing to ensure successful implementation

WE VALUE

Master’s degree in electrical engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or related field.5+ years of experience with industrial process controls, process automation and optimization.Knowledge of advanced control strategies and algorithms.Familiarity with industrial communication protocols.Knowledge of platforms and virtualization, (Windows server/clients, VMWare), networking software and/or Cisco networks, and programming languagesHoneywell control systems experience, including ExperionPKS®Strong problem-solving skills including ability to proactively anticipate requirements and identify/mitigate potential issues before they occur

Benefits

We offer a full benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, 401(k), flexible vacation and education assistance. Benefits provided may differ by role and location.

Visit benefits.honeywell.com to learn more.

Additional Information

JOB ID: req443233Category: EngineeringLocation: 2101 CityWest Blvd,Houston,Texas,77042,United StatesExempt

Engineering (GLOBAL)

Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
